snippet: The pilot did not mention any trouble, a senior Malaysian official said, reinforcing theories that one or both of the pilots may have been involved in diverting the plane.
abstract: Malaysian official reveals last transmission from Captain Zaharie Ahmad Shah of Malaysian Airlines Flight 370 came after plane's signaling system was disabled, fueling speculation that one or both pilots may have been involved in diverting the plane; suspicion of foulplay has refocused case, as officials brief representatives from 22 countries that will aid in coordinated search along two corridors where plane may have wound up.

byline.original: By CHRIS BUCKLEY and KEITH BRADSHER
byline.contributor: Michael Forsythe contributed reporting from Sepang, Malaysia, and Kirk Semple from Kuala Lumpur.

lead_paragraph: The pilot did not mention any trouble, a senior Malaysian official said, reinforcing theories that one or both of the pilots may have been involved in diverting the plane.

headline.main: Timing of Report by Flight’s Pilot Focuses Inquiry
headline.print_headline: Timing of Report by Flight’s Pilot Focuses Inquiry
